revised_title: Total Eclipse of the Sun: Observations and Findings from the Santa Pola Expedition
tldr: The authors describe their observations and findings during the total solar eclipse of May 28, 1900, focusing on the solar corona, prominences, and chromosphere. They used various instruments, including prismatic cameras and coronagraphs, to capture detailed spectra and images of the solar phenomena. The results provide valuable data for understanding the composition and structure of the sun's outer layers.
